Class LagrangeInt2

extends LagCore
    Lagrange interpolation in 2-dimension
    Since:
    Sindo 3.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kiyoshi Yagi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[][] getCoeff()
      Returns the coefficients of the polynomial function.
      double[] getG()
      Returns the gradient of the interpolated function at the current point.
      double[][] getH()
      Returns the Hessian matrix of the interpolated function at the current point.
      double getV(double xx, double yy)
      Sets the current point to (xx,yy) and returns the interpolated value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LagrangeInt2

        public LagrangeInt2(double[] xg,
                    double[] yg,
                    double[] vg)
        Constructor of 2D interpolation
        Parameters:
        xg - the grid points in the x-direction
        yg - the grid points in the y-direction
        vg - the values at grid points in the order of [x1y1, x2y1, .., xny1, x1y2, ..]

      • LagrangeInt2

        public LagrangeInt2(double[] xg,
                    double[] yg,
                    double[][] vg)
        Constructor of 2D interpolation
        Parameters:
        xg - the grid points in the x-direction
        yg - the grid points in the y-direction
        vg - the values at grid points [ny][nx]

        yy - the y value
